related.meaning: red or gold circle representing the Sun
gathering material (for an article, novel, etc.)

lessons.japanese: パーティーの日取りはまだはっきり決まっていない。
lessons.english: The date of the party is still up in the air.

lessons.japanese: 彼等は旅行の日取りを決めた。
lessons.english: They determined the date for the trip.

lessons.japanese: 彼らは結婚式の日取りを繰り上げた。
彼らは結婚式の日取りをまだ決めていない。
lessons.english: They haven't fixed a date for their wedding yet.

lessons.japanese: 彼らは結婚式の日取りと場所を決めた。
lessons.english: They set the time and place of the wedding.

lessons.japanese: 彼らは結婚式の日取りと場所を決めた。
lessons.english: They decided on the date and location of their wedding.

lessons.japanese: 彼らは結婚の日取りを新聞に発表した。
lessons.english: They announced the date of their wedding in the newspaper.

lessons.japanese: 彼らに結婚式の日取りを聞きたい。
lessons.english: I want to ask them when their big day is.

lessons.japanese: 彼らに結婚式の日取りを聞きたい。
lessons.english: I want to ask them when their wedding day is.

lessons.japanese: 同窓会の日取りを決めた。
lessons.english: We fixed the date for our class reunion.

lessons.japanese: 同窓会の日取りを決めた。
lessons.english: We've decided the date for our class reunion.

lessons.japanese: 同窓会の日取りを決めた。
lessons.english: We've decided on the date for our class reunion.

lessons.japanese: 同窓会の日取りを決めた。
lessons.english: We've set the date for our class reunion.

lessons.japanese: 先生は試験の日取りを早めた。
lessons.english: Our teacher advanced the date of the exam.

lessons.japanese: 次の会合の日取りを決めた。
lessons.english: We agreed on a date for the next meeting.
